User Guide#

LaME is built in Python3.11 using PyQt5 for the user interface. Most of the plotting is handled by matplotlib, with some of the more dynamic plots using pyqtgraph.

There are two ways to use LaME, either as a precompiled executable or using the source code. The latter will always be up to date, but may occasionally break as we improve the code, implement new features, or experiment with new tools. If you do use the source, we suggest you download a distribution manager such as GitHub Desktop which can be used to monitor changes and easily download new versions.
